404.description: The requested resource could not be found but may be available in the future. Subsequent requests by the client are permissible.

500.description: A generic error message, given when an unexpected condition was encountered and no more specific message is suitable.

400.description: The server cannot or will not process the request due to an apparent client error.

401.description: Similar to 403 Forbidden, but specifically for use when authentication is required and has failed or has not yet been provided.

403.description: The request was valid, but the server is refusing action. The user might not have the necessary permissions for a resource.

422.description: The request was well-formed but was unable to be followed due to semantic errors.
